website_summaries.verdict: While the open-back design isn't good for noisy environments, the Grado SR80e headphones sound exceptionally good for $100 and are also comfortable to wear.
pros: The Grado SR80e headphones offer impressive sound for the modest $100 price and are comfortable to wear, especially for an on-ear model
Thanks to the open-back design, stereo imaging is more spacious and natural
cons: beefy plug isn't compatible with many smartphone cases

customer_reviews.title: WOW! Best headphones I've ever owned!
customer_reviews.text: There are a great product! I've had many cans over the decades and these are hands down the best. I can't believe the whining about comfort...ow, owww, owww! "The foam cups are too scratchy and the headband padding is too hard and it's too tight on my pinhead", PLEASE. I've got a large melon, just got these today and I've had them strapped on for over four hours without any issues. These are amazing. My music library is reborn:>) I'm just sad I waited so long to pull the trigger but now IT"S ON! If music definition and clarity is important to you, you owe it to yourself to try Grado. Thank you very much.
customer_reviews.author: japhakrfnb

customer_reviews.title: I'm happy
customer_reviews.text: I like open air headphones. I like this pair a lot. The sound is as good as my hearing can distinguish. The response is clear at all frequencies and the headphones are comfortable. I can listen to music for hours without either ear fatigue or my head hurting.
customer_reviews.author: Michael McKeeTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Good Sound Quality...... For the first 2 months
customer_reviews.text: I had heard so many good things about these headphone in the sound department. Not so much for the build quality as a lot of people's headphones had broken. Mine have not broken since the purchase date, however they have encountered other issues. The sound quality started out EXCELLENT but as time went on the bass and treble (mostly bass) started to have major distortion after the volume level reached anything over 30% volume. Very disappointing for a $100 pair of headphones. I have now purchased the Audio Technica ATH-M40x headphones (which was one of my original choices but sadly I went with these headphones). Hopefully my pair was just bad set and it wont happen to any of you.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Screaming headphones that lack warmth, care, and overall body.
customer_reviews.text: As a professional violinist (that spends tons of time listening to treble), I came in with high expectations after extensive research. Unfortunately, at the very first (and every other) hearing, the headphones SCREAMED into my ears. Every classical, and other, music I heard was incredibly piercing and fatiguing. I tried EQ to no avail. These headphones were supposed to upgrade my trusted AKG 240 Studio (made in Austria), but they reaffirmed the AKG’s greatness. The Grados just lack spaciousness, warmth, feeling, love. I only heard yelling.
customer_reviews.author: Angel Valchinov

customer_reviews.title: Great sound (which is why I bought them), but build quality leaves a lot to be desired
customer_reviews.text: See my video for a more in depth discussion on these headphones, but here are the main points: Pros: sound is really nice, especially at this price point. Cons: build quality doesn't instill much confidence, not the most comfortable headphones (but not the worst either). Overall for the price I think these are a good deal, as long as you understand what open back headphones are (see video) and that these are on-ear, wired headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Derek H.

customer_reviews.title: Feed the SR325's good source material
customer_reviews.text: I've been working my way up the Grado food chain - first the SR60, then the SR225, now the SR325e. Each step of the way the improvement was an obvious and significant upgrade in sound quality and well worth the expenditure. Feed the SR325's good source material, and you are rewarded with a broad soundstage, precise imaging, strong and well-controlled bass, and beautiful and crystalline highs. No listening fatigue whatsoever. What typically ends my extended listening sessions is listener fatigue. These are one of the better price/quality values in audio.
customer_reviews.author: GJMAlcyon

customer_reviews.title: Decent Sound
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is certainly respectable but you'll have to compare it to other headphones to see if it's to your individual taste. The foam padding is just too cheap and I'm surprised they're still using it. It's so uncomfortable and, well, cheap in a bad way. And the alternative made by another company is just as cheap and uncomfortable. Ultimately returned it and opted for another brand that sounded better at a similar price and the padding is way more comfy.
customer_reviews.author: J. Ing

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: These are great sounding headphones especially for the price. Sound rivals my vintage Senn HD580 but the Grado is a bit more clinical and not quite as smooth with a bit tighter bass. I prefer the Grado for pop & jazz, the HD580 for classical. Build quality is cheap (plastic ear cups, no padding in headband) but they are comfortable enough to wear for long periods. Not impressed with Amazon's shipping method. The Grado's arrived unprotected in their flimsy retail box (one corner ripped open), with a UPS label stuck to it. They could have at least shipped them in a padded envelope. Thankfully, the headphones were undamaged. Highly recommended if you love music and on a tight budget.
customer_reviews.author: davige

customer_reviews.title: Old Friends
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are the kind of product you buy and immediately replace if you’ve lost or broken them. I had a pair years ago and have always missed them. Now I have my preciousess again and it’s like having an old friend back! Fantastic sound quality, very full and clear sound. Definitely stronger on the low end but not excessively or at the expense of clarity elsewhere. If you want the best overall listening experience 100 bucks can buy I think these are the one.
customer_reviews.author: livnxtreem

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after a month - bad components
customer_reviews.text: Well, these were pretty great, the cups get a little hot, they might be a little tight if you have a large head, but decent. Unfortunately, the swiveling mechanism doesn't allow for much slack when considering components, and so the left side died after a month. Pretty cheaply made, not like Grado used to be (parents had some). I was looking for a replacement for my Sennheisers, which isn't as good as they used to be either, but it looks like I'll have to keep searching for a decent manufacturer of real headphones to drop hundreds of dollars on. Glad this was a less expensive learning experience than it could have been
customer_reviews.author: mcyrus

customer_reviews.title: These Headphones Changed my Life
customer_reviews.text: These will not give you the bass that will implode your eardrums, or the loudness to destroy your hearing. These are made so that you can enjoy and hear things you have never heard before from songs you listen to. These headphones will make it impossible to listen to low quality (recording quality) music, they will turn your world inside out and change your music taste. I imagine it as having drank cheap wine all my life and then been given a glass of Penfolds Grange Hermitage 1951 and realizing your entire life has been a lie.
customer_reviews.author: Klingon

customer_reviews.title: Grado SR325e Prestige Series
customer_reviews.text: I'm writing this review after a year and a half of use. Pros: - Audio quality is awesome. - Materials used are great. - Very sturdy headphones, I have other Grado SR80 I bought about 8years ago and still working like new. Cons: - Cushions are not long lasting, after a while they start to crumble. - (Subjective)Not suitable after a couple hours of use, ears get pretty hot. Recommendation: Looking for affordable professional headphones? Buy it, good choice for beginners and good choice for long lasting ones.
customer_reviews.author: Rubo

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Working... after 1 week of use
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after less than ONE WEEK. I bought these last fall and got busy with my military retirement, moving and job hunting and never got around to even trying them until this past week. They look great and are very comfortable. I'm using them with a Benchmark DAC3 connected to my pc, an ASUS Xonus 24/192 sound card and Qobus, Tidal, and Spotify. The sound is pretty good... but I started intermittently losing sound out of the right side earlier this week. Now today the left side, and then both sides at the same time. I'm being careful with volume levels but these headphones just quit... and these are part of Grado Labs "Prestige Series"... very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: M. Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: If you are hesitating read this.
customer_reviews.text: I'm astounded by how this headphones sound. About 6 years ago I owned a pair of sr125s and they seemed a bit bass lacking (but still great), that made me hesitate to buy these. Believe me when I tell you, they ain't bass lacking, they are far from that, they produce a ridiculously clear, natural sound, incredible highs and mids, and bass is exceptional. Everything is just there. Stop thinking and BUY them, trust me is a decision you wont regret.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Suits my needs very well.
customer_reviews.text: I like the on-the-ear design, and I don't mind that it allows me to here (muffled) conversations around me. My goal is not to be isolated. I use it for piano practice on a digital instrument, often several hours a day. After some time, there is a sensation of heat on the ears - and it's time for a break. I think I get along verywell with this headphone, and I like it. The bass might be a bit boomy - but there are digital ways of manipulating sound to my preference, and at this price, and for my purposes, it's fine The cable is unnecessarily thick - adding tot he weight. I think this was a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: bleuler

customer_reviews.title: These Grado 80e's have a sound like I've never heard before
customer_reviews.text: These are the real deal, because I own several other different sets by different manufactures, And there is no comparison, none at all. These Grado 80e's have a sound like I've never heard before. I have poor hearing and believe me I can hear music through these, I haven't heard in years. I use them with a Sony Walkman, and Insignia CD players, and my HP laptop to watch movies. I just can't say enough good things about how much joy this head set has brought into my life. I bought them through Amazon as an open box for a really great price. Around $84.00. You just can't go wrong using Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for classical music including opera
customer_reviews.text: I have several pairs of headphones and several pairs of FiiO headphone amplifier. I listen to my Blu ray player by connecting the optical sound output of the TV fist to a receiver and then via the receiver to the FiiO for fine adjustment, before connecting it my headphones. I find that without the receiver, the FiiO amplifier will muffle the sound. With the combination, the GRADO SR125e provides clear distinction among the sounds generated by the different instruments in an orchestra. To me, this is the most important requirement in listening to classical music. The vocal sound in opera is stunning.
customer_reviews.author: David T. Yu

customer_reviews.title: excellence at an affordable price point
customer_reviews.text: PROS: o Comfortable o Excellent sound field/reproduction IMHO o appear to be of high quality and good construction. and at an affordable price point CONS: None for me Yes, these *do* leak sound as they are an open back design, something that you may need to consider. Great sound, high quality, comfortable --- while all "subjective" observations based on my own personal preferences, I think most people will find these to be an outstanding price/performance value, which the reviews seem to bear out. I would buy these again in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: Walt

customer_reviews.title: 80$ - Made in The USA - Buy Them Now
customer_reviews.text: The Grado SR60e are one of if not the best pair of headphones you can get for under 100$ It has fantastic highs, sound stage, imaging, forward mids, natural and detailed sound reproduction overall. The build quality isn't that great. The cable isn't detachable and it's quite thick and heavy. These aren't exactly portable headphones. But besides that, I implore you to purchase these headphones and just listen to them. If you don't like them, then take advantage of your 30 day return privilege Amazon provides. I guarantee that you will love these headphones. I'd say for the average listener, they'll think these are magical and for the experienced audiophile, they'll be pleasantly surprised.
customer_reviews.author: Nick DeGeorge

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound, long lasting
customer_reviews.text: Bought these 5 years ago and still use them as my primary headphones, I've tried getting wireless or gamer headphones to 'upgrade' and always ended up returning them because others just can't compete with the quality of these Grados. These are so comfortable I can wear them for long gaming sessions or on the plane for long flights. Previously I had a pair of the 60-series and loved them, the 80s have been equally awesome, highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: FB

customer_reviews.title: I really wanted these to work!
customer_reviews.text: While I really liked the sound that came from these headphones, specifically for symphonic music, they just didn't last and weren't too comfortable. As for comfort, I could get past that. The sound was good enough to deal with it. Quality of construction presented two issues, and both were related to the cable. The cable is a big mangled mess. Normally this wouldn't bother me either. I just marked it up as a typical pain normally experienced with wired headsets. What finally got to me was the fact that the Plug actually failed (shorted), and then broke. That's when I called it quits. I cannot recommend.
customer_reviews.author: ry-mac

customer_reviews.title: ... this 5 stars in a second - they sound GREAT! Their problem is the wire where it enters ...
customer_reviews.text: If I was only to comment on the sound I would give this 5 stars in a second - they sound GREAT! Their problem is the wire where it enters the headphones tends to wear out and now all you have left is e-waste. I just bought these to replace my SR80 that failed so I paid the extra few bucks to get the insurance. Fantastis sound but delicate wiring that once breaks is sadly un-repairable.
customer_reviews.author: Reader

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones
customer_reviews.text: I have used 125's for many years and really wanted these headphones for a long time. I like the design, the weigh and the comfort. The sound is very pleasant and a touch above the 125's. A bit more in range and clarity. I have always enjoyed the Grado sound as I shy away from over exaggerated boomy bass and lows. These present great sound staging and tight bass (bass slaps and drums).
customer_reviews.author: R. Gomez

customer_reviews.title: Solid bargain
customer_reviews.text: Maybe it's just my first high-grade headphones acquisition but I am very impressed. (My past experience is with the like of Sony and JVC cheapies - under $25). Sound is great and I love the long and SOLID cord with a top-grade plug (I'm an electrical engineer & notice these things). This model is I think the low-end of the Grado open-cup design but i am very happy with it. The only negative is that the pads on the cups come off very easily; I can't imagine why they made them that way but if you don't let your cat play with them t's OK.
customer_reviews.author: rude man

customer_reviews.title: Amazing headphones, but.....
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are pure clarity. There bright and beautiful sounding with no distortion. However, I returned them due to the law of diminshing returns. I own the SR80Es and they are the best headphones I’ve ever owned and they produce great sounds as well. Because of this I did not believe there was enough difference in sound between the two headphones to justify a $100 price spike.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super clear, Grado is quality!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! These headphones are crazy clear. You will hear music the way it was intended. The audio is well balanced. If you are looking for something that will emphasize bass, these are not headphones you want. The drivers are super clear, from the highs, mids, to bass everything is clear. The headband is ok, while thin, the headphones are light making hours of use comfortable. The body construction is plastic and the cable is thick. Not an ideal travel set. I use these for my channel, for the price, I don't think you'll find a better set!
customer_reviews.author: Waves & Trails

customer_reviews.title: Grado SR325e upgrade from SR80e
customer_reviews.text: After loving the Grado SR80e for over a year I wanted to upgrade. I read all the reviews and purchased the Sennheiser HD 598 SR Open-Back Headphones. I did not like the Sennheiser HD 598 SR, found them not as comfortable as the Grado SR80's and did not like the sound as much. Then I purchased the Grado SR325e's much brighter sound better sound stage and more complete sound. I did not know what I was missing with the SR80's . SR325e are great headphones definitely worth the increased cost.
customer_reviews.author: Rick T

customer_reviews.title: Wounderful Sound
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful Sound at reasonable price. This is the second pair of Grado Cans I have owned. I've stepped up this time from the 80R series and am not regretting it. The Grado sound is unlike any other, clean, crisp, clear. It helps that I mate the Grados to a Nu Force uDAC. They combine for a listening experience that handles whatever kind of music I throw at it. As I have a wide assorment of music and musical taste I do need a pair of cans that can shift from Jazz to Rock to Classical to spoken word without missing a beat. The Grados do this with aplomb.
customer_reviews.author: James S. LesekeTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: More comfortable than my SR325e's
customer_reviews.text: I have turned several musician and audiophile friends alike onto these headphones. They really are a must have for any headphone collector. Keep in mind that you will be able to hear outside noise very clearly through them, and people near you will be able to hear what you are listening to. This can be a blessing or a curse, but for me the open back clarity is worth the potential drawbacks, plus I can hear if a family member or coworker is yelling for me and can walk around listening to them in public places without completely giving up one of my senses.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sweet and scintillating
customer_reviews.text: Sweet and scintillating. That's how I would describe these headphones. What a pleasant surprise to my ears. I have to say that I am very impressed with these. Glad I picked them up. Highly recommended. Using them with my Audioquest Dragonfly and the combo is hard to beat. Update on 10-13-16: There is no contest when these are compared to the AKG K240s. The AKGs are good, but the SR80es blow them away in terms of clarity, and especially presence. These are absolutely the sweetest sounding headphones that I have come across in this affordable price range.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Good bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: I just wanted to pop on and say these are really good headphones and have great sound quality... actually really good bass; I’m not sure what some of the other reviewer‘s compare it to but it’s pretty accurate. Overall the sound is pretty there, not hyper detailed as some might say but I guess it depends on what audio background you have. These are good headphones but I unfortunately had to return them because they’re a little snug for my ears which are very sensitive. I’ve tried other headphones like this in the past and they’re all uncomfortable to me but many other people I think you’ll like these.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel J. Werner

customer_reviews.title: Stop!  Go no further.  The SR225e is a wonder to behold.
customer_reviews.text: Nothing in my opinion compares to the Grado line of US made headphones. Brilliant highs, improved bass over earlier models and exceptional mids, the new e line sets the bar very very high for $200 non- noise canceling headphones. There may be more comfortable headphones but nothing compares to the sound quality of the SR225e in this price range. Pure, wonderful crystal clear sound. These are the ones to buy and I have sampled more headphones than I can shake a stick. You will hear things you never heard before. I am a bass player and have a very sensitive ear.
customer_reviews.author: rk

customer_reviews.title: They don't last.
customer_reviews.text: Pro: When new and in working order they sound excellent and fit very well. Con: Durability on these are awful. The ear cups are free to rotate an unlimited number of times around the posts holding them to the headband. There is no strain relief on the wires going into them, and nothing to prevent them cups from twisting around and back and forth until they begin to fray through the wires causing them to occasionally inject static and then start dropping sound out. Even taking extreme care to prevent them from flopping and spinning around when taking them on/off this causes them to start failing in a year or two.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Sound Quality
customer_reviews.text: Excellent sound quality for the price. Audio is very clear and listenable even at very low levels. There seems to be no extraneous noises from these headphones. One minor drawback is that the headphones initially feel uncomfortable since the earpieces seem to be at an awkward angle. However, after listening for a few minutes this feeling of discomfort goes away. The other drawback is that sounds from the surroundings are not muffled in any way. I would not recommend these headphones if they are to be used in a noisy environment. They are also highly recommended by Consumer Reports.
customer_reviews.author: Harvey Waldman

customer_reviews.title: just got them yesterday
customer_reviews.text: they arrived yesterday so I can't speak about how well they stand up to use. sound quality is very good and they are feel comfortable after wearing them for several hours of listening to music. Are they the best for sound quality? I have no idea but with my hearing issues they worked quite well for me. I didn't notice any outside noise interference while using them. as for recommending them to others I would say absolutely as long as you realize they are new so I have no idea if they will work in six months or something will break tomorrow. but they sound better and feel more comfortable than the last headset I paid twice the money for.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Splendid sound
customer_reviews.text: I mostly listen to classical music; renaissance and baroque. I have Koss headphones (from 1951) and several new and near new B&O and Bose headphones and earphones. These Grado headphones are, by a startlingly wide margin, the best I have ever heard & used. At the price, an incredible bargain and, for the concerned, made in Brooklyn, NY.
customer_reviews.author: Revvie

customer_reviews.title: Open backed. For home use or when you know you'll be alone
customer_reviews.text: Changed the way I thought about headphones. Instead of the fatigue I usually feel with closed backed cans. Grado's open spacious sound is infectious. They sound damn good from the phone jack but when hooked to a quality headphone section you will be in audiophile heaven. These are stereo headphones. Take them out. People are going to hear your tunes. They look funky cool. Lightweight. Underbuilt. I've landed. These are my last headphones. Grado!
customer_reviews.author: Avery

customer_reviews.title: Cranky, excessive upper midrange and lower treble.
customer_reviews.text: Cranky, , excessive upper midrange and lower treble. Not sure how these have gotten so many good reviews, just goes to show, dont trust the reviews. Yes they has some detail, but who cares, stick you head in a horn tweeter and you will hear much detail. The sound is almost unbearable at higher volumes. Its like someone just turned the treble way up on a horn speaker.
customer_reviews.author: EN

customer_reviews.title: Great sound for the price horrible build
customer_reviews.text: These headphones sound great and comfortable for long periods of time. However, there plastic build is just not great for what you would think of the Grado brand. I think the cable is the worst part. It feels just so awful and it is so rigid. Surprising they would put such an awful cable on something that otherwise isn't too bad for the price. I would say to buy but be ready for good sound but just awful build and if the cable breaks its over.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: SR 225e are fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Such an upgrade over the 60 & 80 but all of Grado's line has their ups and downs. The 225e are absolutely phenomenal headphones with such clarity and ease to the sound. Great for jazz and rock, not perfect for metal but with something like a Schiit Loki you can really dial in a pleasant sound. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Neutrality

customer_reviews.title: High quality product.  Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Great sound. Was not expecting the detail and sensitivity. Well constructed. Best purchase I've ever made. But yes, people around you will hear what you're listening to, also. But these are so worth it, just doesn't matter. Was looking at these for months before I made up my mind to just go ahead and spend a little more than what I had been spending for headphones, the justification being cheaper ones from other companies do tend to break very easily, as well as more likely to have overall quality issues. If you're gonna buy headphones, I recommend this company first. Thanks again!
customer_reviews.author: Slimfatguy

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded expectations
customer_reviews.text: I've only listened to streaming mp3s so far and I'm blown away. Responsive bass, can hear every scratch of a callus on a guitar strIng, etc. Makes my garbage-produced, first-take, home-recorded music sound like something you'd hear on the radio which far exceeded my expectations. I used to have a pair of the Klipsch Image One on-ear phones, loved those, these are even better in sound and comfort for the same cost. Would have appreciated a case at this price point, but I'm sure every cent went into the sound quality. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: reesemeese

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, great sound. Not noise cancelling
customer_reviews.text: These are not noise cancelling headphones. That is not a criticism, it's just how they are designed. Overall sound quality is excellent, bass is adequate. If you like overdone, in your face bass, these are not for you. Mids are clean, highs are great but NN it too bright. They work straight off my iPhone. No headphone amp necessary. Others in the room may hear y9ur music since they're not closed-back. And since they let external sound in they might not be good for outdoors, airplane etc. Very very good, especially for the price. They give my Monoprice planar magnetic headphones a run for the money.
customer_reviews.author: P. Pereira

customer_reviews.title: Best sound you can buy.
customer_reviews.text: I can't get over how great these sound, but there is one major flaw that, for most, is unavoidable. There is a rattle/buzz in the speaker that happens with strong bass frequencies. Doing some research I found this is common and it's been named "grado grattle". It's supposedly caused by hair that gets into the speakers. Very frustrating, however at low volumes, this is still the best pair of headphones I've ever heard and will gladly buy another. (Compared with many audio technica headphones as they're usually my go to.)
customer_reviews.author: Randall

customer_reviews.title: Painful to wear
customer_reviews.text: No complaints about the sound, although to be honest I prefer the cheaper SR60s. The real problem with both pairs of headphones is they are simply very uncomfortable. My head's a bit above average size, so maybe that explains it. But I can't wear these for more than 30 minutes at a time. Upgraded to Sennheiser 6xx/650 and love them.
customer_reviews.author: Gregg Re

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional, well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: The sound from these beautiful headphones is so accurate and tight--wow! They are well designed and fit so well against my ears--as if I could wear them for 8 hours and not feel any discomfort. They look so cool. Got that retro audiophile look to them. Good story behind them too. Much love to the Grado family and employees (whom I don't know, but I do know and love Brooklyn). I took 1 star off from this product because it was packaged in non-recyclable foam.
customer_reviews.author: N. Bobil

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Muffs Twisting Cable Buyers Beware
customer_reviews.text: Duped! They must be putting out a different product than reviewed here, or I received a lemon. I’m a director and the sound guy said these should be good enough sound quality-the irrevocable flaws are other issues: a twisting cable around the neck that after 10 days of use, is now unable to be detangled. On day one, the cheap foam muffs that are loosely wrapped on a plastic ledge constantly fell off... which had me searching on the ground with my assistant between takes. Finally we glued them on...but this is bush league product with no business touting any quality whatsoever. DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT.
customer_reviews.author: A. Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Phones I've Ever Used
customer_reviews.text: The first time I tried these headphones I thought the auto-mute function on my audio system had failed and that the speakers were still on, the sound I was hearing was that impressive. These phones produce a sound stage that is clear, open, detailed and wide ranging. Individual orchestral details are easily heard on a good recording. The bass is full and upper end clearly presented. One caveat, though, they do require a headphone amplifier with pretty good driving capability. My professional A/D converter headphone output drives them easily; the headphone jack on my late-model iMac does not. That need aside, they are magnificent.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... to upgrade from my SR80i which I was very happy with. No regrets
customer_reviews.text: Decided to upgrade from my SR80i which I was very happy with. No regrets. The SR325 is superior in every way. Listening to SACDs through my MAD EAR+ HD headphone amp and the sound is incredible.Richer and clearer than the SR80s. No problems with comfort, just got done with a 3hr listening session. My audio system is now complete.
customer_reviews.author: Archie Sterling

customer_reviews.title: The best affordable open-back headphones for rock music
customer_reviews.text: Splendid soundstage. Really makes the guitar and vocals shine. Low-freq bass lacks punch - but it's got more bass than you'd expect after reading reviews online. Not a flat sound signature, but peaks at all the right places for rock music. Low impedance, so no amp required. Thick durable cable. Extremely light and comfortable - especially for someone who wears spectacles - due to it's on-ear design. Build is plastic which to me only means that Grado focused on what's important - the sound.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me.
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to get these! I had saved up a lot of gift cards to get theses and read all of the reviews.I was verry happy when the came and I opened the box and on the top was a piece of paper that says "Welcome to the family." I just about fainted with delight.They were made extremely well and I pluged them up and.............the sound was very low.My $20 amazon basics were better then these.Needless to say,I packed them back up and sent them back.
customer_reviews.author: Kecia

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: This is the second pair of these headphones we have purchased. I originally purchased the first pair for my wife, and at the same time, another brand of slightly more expensive headphones for myself. After three years of side by side comparison, the Grados are clearly the better designed, higher quality product. My headphones have literally fallen apart and finally broken while the Grados show hardly any signs of wear. Which is why I'm buying Grados for myself now.
customer_reviews.author: John L. Rose

customer_reviews.title: Good, but I'd get the SR80's again
customer_reviews.text: A lot of the other reviews go into the audiohile jargon about how these sound so I'll defer to them on that. My two cents - I got these to replace a pair of SR80's I'd broken (100% my fault, not a durability thing). I figured I might as well upgrade but these don't sound any better to me. They sound good though and I'm not dissatisfied. They also get uncomfortable after more than a couple hours.
customer_reviews.author: Atticus Taintwater

customer_reviews.title: Superb Sound and Comfort
customer_reviews.text: - These are super comfortable (even with the stock pads), I wear them for 8-12 hours a day programming - Great sound in highs and mids, i've been listening to 60-70's rock and some 90's grunge all day and the sound is great - Also good for EDM, Metal, and some hard rock.. - Rap/Heavy Bass sounds good, but if you prefer this kind of music your money is better spent elsewhere (maybe sennheiser?) - Cable is super heavy duty, will not kink up or anything Only negative is really just a reminder, these are open back headphones.. everyone in the room will hear your music (and you can hear them talking through the music.. kinda surreal)
customer_reviews.author: P. Palmieri

customer_reviews.title: Great sounding headphones that do not trick out the bass ...
customer_reviews.text: Great sounding headphones that do not trick out the bass or do things that tries to make it sound like it is better than it is. Great mid range for vocals, readings or any music. Clear and no low background hissing like most other headphones. For the price, you really can't beat the sound quality. Their higher end ones have better build but this one is great value. I do not wear it for a long time so I don't know the comfort level if you wear it for over 2-3 hours since it is an over the ear headphones I would suspect there will be some pressure on the ears if worn for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis Wee

customer_reviews.title: Superb
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love the sound and style of these. Some notes of mine about these. -The open back design doesn't leak nearly as much noise as i thought it would. -They were much lighter than i anticipated, however they still feel solidly built -The cable is ridiculously. 6ft and probably about 1/4" thick. These weren't meant to be portable. -Headband takes a little bit of time to break in but feels more comfortable once it does. If i were to lose these id buy another set in a heartbeat, however I'm not sure if these are worth the price over the sr80s.
customer_reviews.author: Alec Wilder

customer_reviews.title: Detail, detail, detail
customer_reviews.text: There's not much to say about these headphones that other reviewers haven't said. But if you love hearing all the details in any recording this is the headphone for you. The bass may not have weight but it's there. Bass that is clear and fast and doesn't overpower the other frequencies. I'd say if you want a Grado this is the one to get. Bass heads will need to look somewhere else though.
customer_reviews.author: APC Houston

customer_reviews.title: Good audio, bad headband
customer_reviews.text: This is my first set of Grados and I'm planning on getting some higher end ones -- for sure. I'm not one to describe the quality in precise terms, but I personally like them. As a person thag has only used closed backs in the past, I must say these didn't convince me out of the box but I've come to appreciate the added quality it gives some genres - rock, blues, alternative, some instrumentals - that just so happen to be some of my favorite genres. Worked out awesome in the end. This pair isn't too pricey to the point to take the risk -- but I'm sure you'll be glad you did.
customer_reviews.author: Lirio

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good for under $300.
customer_reviews.text: I liked the headphones they make for $99. These 225es are better sounding, but the same el cheapo foam on the earpieces. Better than average sound at this price. I tried the other models in the price range between the 99 and these and they were not as good as the $99. So either get those or step up to these or better. A little heavy on the bass, but very good sound overall.
customer_reviews.author: audiodude

customer_reviews.title: I do not want money back, I just want a new headphone PLEASE!!
customer_reviews.text: The glue or whatever that holds the speaker together came apart after 6 months. I am not sure if the humidity of South Florida had anything to do with it. I have owned these same headphones with no problem before in North Carolina. I am very upset, to say the least. I bought it from a 3rd Party on Amazon, so I really have no idea how to get a new one or anything. I have always bragged about how good Grados are, so this is very depressing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality for your money
customer_reviews.text: Definitely the nicest headphones I've tried anywhere near this price point. They let some ambient noise in, and also bleed some sound. Neither bothers me at all, and I wear them for many hours at a go comfortably at work. The bass is a little strong compared to reference sound, but it's nice and clean. Probably what most people want. Oddly, they sound terrible without the foam covers. They must have been heavily tuned to these particular muffs. Lastly, I wear hearing aids, and the open style headphones let me keep them in. No interference, feedback or physical discomfort. It lets my brain stay on the same page.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Kernbaum

customer_reviews.title: Great sound for the price
customer_reviews.text: These headphones were recommended by a friend. After a couple of days, they had a great fit. The sound is clear with a great range of frequencies. They are comfortable to wear for an extended period. I wear hearing aids and sometimes forget to take them off but the headphones adjust nicely. This product is made in the USA by a family business, and I am giving another pair for the holidays!
customer_reviews.author: David Miller

customer_reviews.title: Nicely showcases the advantages of the open-backed form factor
customer_reviews.text: I'm very impressed with these headphones. Granted, I am not used to open-back headphones, and I haven't tried any of the other prestige models. The impression I get is that you would likely get similar performance from SR80e's, since they most likely use the same drivers (the primary difference being tighter matching tolerances on the higher priced models). That said, this is a superior listening experience to what I am used to from a closed-back headphone like the Sennheiser HD280 Pros, as long as your listening environment doesn't require great isolation. This is not the product for you if you have easily irritated roommates, or if you want to block out engine noise during air travel.
customer_reviews.author: Blaise Brennan

customer_reviews.title: The absolute PERFECT headphones!
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are so well balanced - crisp treble, good midrange and effortless bass. These headphones can handle anything you throw at them. Bass is not overwhelming but it's there and very well reproduced. These are the best headphones I have every listed too. That's including Seinheiser, Bose, Sony, etc. Consumer Reports was right on with their ratings!!!!
customer_reviews.author: David W. Clements

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre at best, feel cheap, uncomfortable, poor sound.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure why rating for those headphones is so high, but there is absolutely nothing special about them. I used them with Audio Quest Dragonfly Black and they produce very poor sound. I own Plantronics Voyager Focus UC Bluetooth USB headset and they produce far better sound. To add insult to the injury they look cheap, feel cheap and are very uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Roman

customer_reviews.title: These are great, neutral headphones and I like the overall weight ...
customer_reviews.text: These are great, neutral headphones and I like the overall weight and comfort of them. I purchased these after hearing a friends SR60e headphones and liking the tone of them. They also go well with my turntable which is using a Grado labs cartridge so things are fairly well matched from that perspective. The head band and adjustments likely won't go small enough if you have a small head, I wear a "Medium" helmet/hat and these will barely adjust small enough to fit my head shape.
customer_reviews.author: John B.

customer_reviews.title: Grado RULES!
customer_reviews.text: I love these phones. They are comfortable to wear, and sound absolutely great, natural, open and uncolored. I also have a set of Grado SR 80-e series, which cost about a third of the price of the SR325e. Are these 3X better than the 80's? I don't know; they're both terrific. If you're in the market for headphones and have a $100 budget, buy the 80's. If you can spend $300 without hurting your budget, get the 325's. Either way, you win. Grado RULES!
customer_reviews.author: O. Stanley

customer_reviews.title: So Glad I Finally Tried Grado
customer_reviews.text: My ears have always rebelled against on ear and over ear headphones, so I mostly use in ears. They're just more comfortable for me. But, I keep looking. These are also uncomfortable for me, but they sound so good I'm willing to remove them every 30 minutes and take a break. I love everything about these, of course mostly the sound quality. In my humble opinion they handle every genre with energy and aplomb. They don't "pop" for me or leave me stunned or speechless--but they're just so competent. I've tried a LOT of bad headphones over the years and these are keepers.
customer_reviews.author: Glen Matthews

customer_reviews.title: They sound good, but they fall apart..
customer_reviews.text: Sound good, but they literally fell apart. I wish I could afford another pair, because the sound was good. I would recommend finding more durable construction if you plan on really using these things. I even made a hard case for these phones, but they crumbled.
customer_reviews.author: Alex L

customer_reviews.title: Love the sound
customer_reviews.text: Love these, the sound is fantastic and I find them comfortable. The open-air makes them good to wear for extended periods, but they can be heard from the outside a bit in case that is an issue. Listened to a whole range of music, you can really hear the quality of the recording - if you play something with unprocessed vocals (uncommon these days), you can really hear it. If you want nice, clean sound across the spectrum, these are for you. If you want thump-thump-thump get Beats or whatever.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Crystal clear music reproduction, light weight and very comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: This product is excellent in what it was designed for. No frills, just stunningly beautiful music reproduction. If you want a pair of headphones that produce crystal clear music, buy a pair, you will be more than satisfied. I have just recently started listening to Grace Vanderwaal's music. I wanted to be able to here her voice clearly and her acoustic accompaniment. These headphones are perfect for this type of music. They exceeded my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: I purchased these because of the reviews and when I ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these because of the reviews and when I got them, I was not all that impressed with the material as they felt cheap. I am comparing these to the look and feel of the Audio Technicas from Guitar Center (about the same price.) I plugged them into several devices: my iPod, iPphone, and computer - they sounded ok. I returned them and went with the Audio Technica. Don't trust your headphones from reviewers, go and try them out in person.
customer_reviews.author: tla

customer_reviews.title: Tremendous, highly detailed sound, however, leakage bothers nearby listeners
customer_reviews.text: I have numerous sets of closed ear headphones and my primary focus is sound accuracy. I really look to hear all the details at a lower volume level than often required. My favorite closed ear headphones get heavy and after a few hours bother my ears. These super light Grado's work exceptionally well at lower volume, extremely enjoyable. Because of their open nature, they do leak sound out the back which my partner found a bit irritating, however, for comfort and quality, they will be hard to beat!
customer_reviews.author: SteveinMA

customer_reviews.title: Super Pleased
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot of great reviews on this headphone set, and my high expectations were met. Great articulation; I can clearly hear background percussion parts that were fully or partially obscured by lesser speakers or headphones. These are comparable and slightly more articulate than some other highly rated headphones that I have that cost twice as much. Great value. I'm tempted to buy a pair of 125's -- the next step up.
customer_reviews.author: A. Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Love/Hate Just As Expected
customer_reviews.text: My father owned a pair of these in the late 90s. I remember these had an amazing sound quality with average build quality. These definitely sound better than my Sennheiser HD558s. The two issues that haunt these are they are not the most comfortable for long hours of listening and you have to be very careful with the cord twisting which will eventually lead to a loss of sound.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Weems

customer_reviews.title: Sound great, but leak sound like crazy
customer_reviews.text: Yes, these headphones have a good sound, especially for the price, but they leak sound so loudly that everyone around you hears almost exactly what you are listening to. I understand these are "open back" and expect some sound leakage, but even at low volume these headphones sound almost the same from the outside as they do while wearing them. Sort of defeats the purpose of headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Brian H. Love

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is the first time in +40 yrs of buying headphones I splurged on a set in the 3-figure range (barely).IThey cost about $100 & I think they're comparable to many others going for 2x - 3x the price, (borrowed from friends who aren't as tight-fisted as I am). They don't look like much but they're very light & comfortable, and Grado will fix headphones past the warranty period (2 yrs in this case) for a flat fee ($40 the last time I looked) as long as it's a model still being made. I use mine at home, they're not noise-cancelling. And they're actually made in the USA (in Brooklyn NY)!
customer_reviews.author: RoboRoy 9000

customer_reviews.title: More than excellent.
customer_reviews.text: I just got these today along with a Black Dragonfly DAC to listen to music on my laptop. I am absolutely blown away how good the sound is. It's like an open window and the sound just pours in. They are very comfortable to wear. I think I made a perfect choice. These are a genuine champ product. I've been an audio fan since my high school days and it's like having it all in my XPS now. Amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Alan Ballai

customer_reviews.title: Great sound!
customer_reviews.text: After my SR80s fell apart in about 2 years, I opted for the SR60s. I liked the others more, but for durability reasons I went for the lower end product. They sound great for the price. These are not really mobile headphones; the chord is chunky and long, they are open-back (loud for those around you), and as mentioned are not very durable, so keep them at home.
customer_reviews.author: Alex L

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for very long.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these based on many recommendations and reviews across the web. For sound quality, they easily score a solid 4.5 or possibly a 5. Unfortunately, just 6 weeks in, under very light duty usage (low volume, no abuse of any kind), the left speaker just stopped working. I have reached out to the manufacturer for warranty support but no response yet.
customer_reviews.author: Vakota

customer_reviews.title: Very good headphones
customer_reviews.text: I really like these headphones. They are a little too bright in the highs, but they reveal details in your music that average inexpensive headphones do not. You become accustomed to the brightness of the highs after awhile, and it is a good trade off for the beautifully revealing open clear sound you get. The bass is also very good and tight. Excellent headphones for going walking , since you can hear everything around you including traffic very well.
customer_reviews.author: carole zeno

customer_reviews.title: Excellent monitor headphones that aren't too expensive
customer_reviews.text: These are excellent headphones for playing what the music track has in it straight, without amplifying portions of the audio. Also, Grado has fixed the annoying twisting-cord problem that plagued the earlier version of these headphone. The 2020 model has a somewhat shorter cord that does not twist around itself and die.
customer_reviews.author: Joe G.

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend you give these a try if you're even a little on the fence.
customer_reviews.text: You've got to try a pair of these. For real. You can wear them for hours and not have "ear burn." Or at least I don't. I guess my ears stick out or something because I usually can't stand over ear style headphones for very long, but these I don't even notice the weight of them after a bit. Like a hat, they're just there.
customer_reviews.author: AdamJayP

customer_reviews.title: I'm VERY satisfied with these headphones.
customer_reviews.text: I've been wanting a pair of high quality open back headphones so I purchased the Grado SR60e. I am very satisfied with these phones. They are comfortable to wear and sound clean and natural with no exaggeration throughout the frequency range. I would recommend these to anyone wanting an accurate reproduction of music for basic reference listening.
customer_reviews.author: Jim G

customer_reviews.title: Good sounding and light headphone in this price range.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my portable MP and think for the money they sound good. If you do not have more to spend I would recommend these. I do find the on ear headphone uncomfortable for long listening sessions. If you are not looking for a light headphone for portable use and will be listening for extended periods I prefer the Sony MDR-7506 in this price range for comfort. The sound between the two is different but I enjoy them both?
customer_reviews.author: AKM

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and wonderful
customer_reviews.text: I have been a long time Grado fan of their phono cartridges. Even their cheapest ones sound great. So, I finally bought one of their headphones, and I am very impressed with them. Very nice tonal balance and great clarity, plenty of volume combined with the inexpensive Schiit headphone amp. No brainer here!
customer_reviews.author: Cygnet

customer_reviews.title: These do sound great! Comfortable and I actually use for working out
customer_reviews.text: These do sound great! Comfortable and I actually use for working out. I've gotten real picky about sound quality. Beside not staying in my ears, I just don't like the sound quality of most earbud style headphones, even the pricey ones. So I need a pair that are lite and sound fantastic. These do. Just one warning, because of the design, they really do leak sound. For me that's not an issue but would not recommend in close confines. If I'm at the gym I use a different style but outside runs and on home stationary bike these really do the job. For me sound quality and comfort are the top priorities. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: Only good for couple of years
customer_reviews.text: The headphone worked great for the first couple of years and then all of a sudden started to make a very annoying buzzing noise in one ear. Because it is past the warranty time (1 year) not much I can do other than through it out! It is a shame to make such a device with good sound quality but terrible durability.
customer_reviews.author: Parinaz Emami

customer_reviews.title: Too bright and too harsh
customer_reviews.text: Far too aggressive and bright (fatiguing). Very detailed in its presentation, but the sound is right up in your face, so to speak. Coming from the ie80 and wanting a more airy presentation (and less bloated bass), I was pretty disappointed by the complete absence of any bass as well as the unyielding presentation of the Grados. Painful.
customer_reviews.author: chaoslimits

customer_reviews.title: Grado 101
customer_reviews.text: So yeah, you need to give em 50 hours or so break-in before the clarity and detail bloom. Also, install the accessory L earpads to remove several veils between your ears and the clearest sound. Finally, pack the edges of the case with rope-putty (used for windows) to add the finishing touch to clean and open sound. Then just enjoy your music!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great sound for reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: I have the $2000 Grados and I have these I use hooked up to my computer. Very open airy sound. Your hear every detail of the music whether rock or classical. Super comfortable! Not meant to be noise canceling, but if you want to relax and listen to music at home, for the price you can’t beat them.
customer_reviews.author: robert a leo

customer_reviews.title: Great Bargain
customer_reviews.text: Glad I got these. Sound great & very comfortable. Excellent quality considering the relatively low price. I almost returned them because they didn't make a good connection into the headphone jack of my HTC phone. But I used a short 4 inch extension cord instead of plugging them directly into the phone and that solved the problem. Now I'm very pleased I kept them.
customer_reviews.author: Anole Watcher Sr.

customer_reviews.title: A Great Value and Made in the USA
customer_reviews.text: Forget about all of that Massdrop hooey, these are real deal. American made, comfortable and stunning, uncolored sound. These are headphones for serious listeners who don't need colors or celebrity endorsers. Just a great value. The only way I would change would be to upgrade to the next model up.
customer_reviews.author: Michael M.

customer_reviews.title: Plan on investing in better pads; otherwise I can't recommend this item
customer_reviews.text: Sound is superb, as expected. I could listen to them all day. Unfortunately, the foam ear pads are rough, heat up quickly and keep falling off the phones. Comfort level is less than acceptable. Plan on investing in better pads; otherwise I can't recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: writing prof

customer_reviews.title: Excellent and worth it
customer_reviews.text: Excellent! I've not heard anything better and I need to listen to my library again. This thing brings out the clarity that no other headphone has in the past. I love the minimal design and quality construction. The only negative point is the cushions but you can do the "sock mod" (google it) and you'd be listening to this for hours! Get this headphone and put your search for the best headphone to an end.
customer_reviews.author: Neil

customer_reviews.title: Best headphones I ever used
customer_reviews.text: The clarity of the sound is well worth the price. Best headphones I ever used. The ear cub is a little bit uncomfortable in the beginning. It takes some time to get used to it. I had many other headphones cheap ones to several hundred dollar ones. None sounded as good as this one.
customer_reviews.author: James Choi

customer_reviews.title: I really enjoyed the 60s
customer_reviews.text: I previously had the SR60s for several years, and my go-to recording studio in NYC used the same model for deep listening to mix-downs. I really enjoyed the 60s, and so far I am enjoying the 125s (with an SMSL preamp). My only irk is the heavy cables tend to twist into the shape they want to take. The left and right cables on mine have decided to cross over each other, and thus lightly squeeze my chin as I listen. Nothing I can do to get them to go the other direction! So the verdict is: Sound is great, but the cables are somewhat pesky.
customer_reviews.author: Rusty

customer_reviews.title: Price for performance champ!
customer_reviews.text: Price to performance is outstanding. After years of mediocre headphones, I bought these. I was hearing stuff in >good< recordings I had never heard before, like did you know there's marimba all the way through Dire Strait's "Private Investigations?" Lifelong fan, never heard it before. I did have to make a headband out of some foam and some goatskin from the local craft store to make it way more comfortable. But they can't get the headband right on the cans 10x the cost of these, so I won't complain that loud.
customer_reviews.author: Robert L Clark

customer_reviews.title: Great value for money.
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding. I just unpacked them and am listening to Pink Floyd’s “Meddle” on Vinyl. They are a revelation. I can’t speak to their durability yet, but the fit feels right and the sound quality is excellent. The bass is strong- I have the bass set fairly high for my speakers, and had to turn it down for these headphones. Overall quite happy with them. Update- a year later and these have become my go-to headphones. I got some planars but these are still in the sweet spot in terms of comfort and sound quality. No appreciable wear in a year. Still happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Cavebat

customer_reviews.title: To all looking for great headphones at a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: To all looking for great headphones at a reasonable price! Look no further. The sound reproduction is rich the dynamics are deep. I would recommend the Grado SR352e's to any one.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Sutcliffe

product_meta.title: Grado SR80e Prestige Series Open Backed Headphone
product_meta.description:
Style Name:SR80eLike all the 'Prestige Series' models, the multi-award winning Grado SR80i is an open-back headphones, on-ear design. It is light, comfortable and built on the same features as the SR60i headphones, but the SR80i utilises a 4 conductor connecting cable and the driver diaphragms are put through a special 'de-stressing' process in order to enhance inner detail. The result is a headset which delivers a wider, more open and dynamic soundstage, but which is also smoother in the treble and deeper and even better controlled in the bass; a sound that is pure Grado.

BOX CONTAINS
1 pair of SR80e headphones
feature_bullets: Grado is pleased to present the new 3rd Generation of their award winning headphones the "e" series. New updated version with improved sound and Build Quality

specifications.Customer reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
